content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Sure! I can help you with that. Here's a function `add_yearmonth` that extracts the year and month from the `dt` column of a given DataFrame `df` and concatenates them together as an integer in the format "yyyymm":

```julia
using DataFrames

function add_yearmonth(df)
    df[:ym] = [Dates.yearmonth(date) for date in df[:dt]]
    df[:ym] = [Dates.year(ym) * 100 + Dates.month(ym) for ym in df[:ym]]
    return df
end
```

You can call this function with your DataFrame `df` as an argument to add the `ym` column:

```julia
df = add_yearmonth(df)
```

This will update `df` by adding a new column `ym` with the year and month values in the desired format.
